word.item: There was one man, he was in Nador, in Zgengen, in a village they call Aghennuy.
At one time, that one, he killed someone from his family.
After he had killed him, he brought (together) his children and fled here.
He came to the mountains, to Targuist, to the mountains of Targuist, over towards Germalet.
Mountains – there was just a forest; there were neither houses nor anything.
He came and entered the forest, cleared some land, made a shack, and hid his children.
Now those people from whose family he killed someone, they are still looking for him.
They followed him, village after village, from Nador, from Zgengen, all the way to Aghennuy.
They were looking for him until they found him.
When they found him, he recognized them, but they did not recognize him.
They asked him to spend the night at his place.
They spent the night with him.
He gave them to eat and to sleep well.
The next day in the morning, he woke them up.
He brought them breakfast, they ate well.
They asked him, (they said) “There’s this certain man, he did such and such...”
“Now if we find him, we’ll kill him.”
He said to them, “That man you’re looking for: Look, that’s me.”
“Now if you want to kill me, Look, that’s it right now.”
“Or if you want to go your way”
“Look, I am that man who killed that man from you(r family) in Aghennuy.”
That’s it, they looked one to another, they were ashamed to kill him.
Because they had eaten his bread.
They had eaten supper, eaten breakfast, slept there, so they were ashamed to kill him.
So this is how that one came from Aghennuy of Nador to Aghennuy of Zerqet, of Germalet, so that he would name that place Agennuy.
On Haguz morning, the women get up in the morning,
So that in that entire year, nothing comes into the house.
We must do this in the Haguz.
Afterwards, at midday or before midday, we cook corn – corn and beans, lentils, and chickpeas.
we call it (we say to it)
That meal, we call it 'khullayta' ("a mixed dish").
So that we keep on eating and eating and eating and eating – just that khullayta (mixed dish).
Then at night, i.e. at night when we come to sleep,
we again eat only special food, we only eat pomegranates and walnuts.
and the pomegranate peelings and walnut shells, we put them near the stove.
They remain there during the night, till the morning or till dawn.
She gets up, our mother gets up, like this,
They throw (away) those peelings and shells.
Here, a year went away, another year is coming.
we call it (we say to it)
The day after it, after Haguz, the day after it, we call it 'Bin ssnin' (Between Years).
After Bin ssnin there is Yennayer (January).
That is the entrance of the (new) year.
During Yennayer there are rituals and songs.
For example, how the young children wake up in the morning.
they go to ask the neighbors, they ask them for eggs
they ask them for eggs, they ask them for money, and they ask them for figs.
There are people who give them bread.
There are people who give them figs.
There are people who give them money.
There are people who give them eggs.
And they go saying these rhyming chants, a lot of children.
They go in groups of ten or fifteen.
Only children who are ten to twelve years old.
They say “O Beautiful (lit. ‘White’) Lady!”, in Arabic, “Give me one egg!”
“to write with it on my board, my board is with the student.!”
And there is, there is another poem:
O Baynu, O Salah (person’s name), Haguz was yesterday
O Baynu, O grandfather, Haguz was yesterday.
“O Baynu, Baynu, Baynu, the girls came out and got cold!”
“O Baynu, Baynu, Baynu, the girls came out and got cold!”
So the people come out, they give eggs to the little children,
Or there are some who give them money,
That's it, they meet the new year in this way.
So, one man with his wife was living in Morocco,
So they remained like this, right?
That man said to his wife:
"Let’s go to France, let’s go to France!
Let’s go to France, let’s travel and see the world."
They went; when they went, they stayed in France some time...
That man, when he came, he found two mice.
he put one here, and he put one here, right?
He went to one Frenchman, he grabbed him, and he kept saying to him:
My wife will cook a roasted chicken.
She will make a salad, she will make everything, for the table...”
He (the Frenchman) told him: “Oh no, the woman still has to go,
she still has to cook, to go to a shop,
she still has to prepare the chicken, that’s a lot.
You still have to go, to tell it to her.”
He (the Moroccan) told him: “Do not be afraid!
I have someone who will go, and will say everything
and will come back to me.”
He took out that mouse, he told it:
“Look, you, you’ll go to the woman,
you will tell her to prepare a roasted chicken,
and to make a salad, and to prepare the table,
like this, to prepare the table.”
They remained like that (i.e. some time passed).
“Look, that mouse went away and did not come back.”
He said to him: “Do not be afraid, it did come back
He took out the other one, and told it:
“Did you say all that to the woman?”
He (the Moroccan) told him: “So, that’s it.”
He (the Frenchman) told him: “Ooooh, this mouse you have is awesome, great!
you will sell it to me
Will you sell it to me?
you will sell it to me
Will you sell it to me?”
I will sell it to you
He told him: “I will sell it to you for two million.”
He gave him that mouse, he took those two million.
He did the same thing that the Moroccan did to him, to the Frenchman,
he in turn did it to another person.
He went, he was telling him like this,
the mouse was saying like this.
That man came to the Moroccan ,
He told him: “When I released that mouse,
it went away and he did not come back.”
He told him: “Did you give it the address?”
He told him: “Did you give it the address of the house?”
So he told him: “It must be lost.

interlinear-text.item: Ketama: A Story about a Bean
Ketama (Beni Hmed) short funny Story about a Bean = Aḥebbʷuyṯ llubiṯ

word.item: in front of, beside, next to

interlinear-text.item: Ketama (Beni Hmed): The story about Hmimes and Ogress = Ḥmimes i Lġula

word.item: And there is one woman her name is Ogress.
They do not agree and they never agreed.
She went, one time, she has a, Lghula has a big place.
There are figs in it, there is a fig tree in it.
In Berber they call it nnuqiṯ (a fig tree).
he eats it to her detriment
Whenever Hmimes comes, he always spends the morning on that fig tree, on that fig, on that early figs, he eats them (to her detriment).
Whenever she comes, she finds Hmimes in it. Whenever she comes, she finds Hmimes in it.
Did you see the (car) crash that happened?
No, I only heard about it.
It happened on the Zeghanghane road.
Yeah, it was a big (car) crash.
Yes, one man and his son died, the poor guys.
He crossed the red light and then a car hit them.
He was probably speeding. Well, may they rest in peace
Just be careful. There are many cars.
It is hot today isn’t it?
Yes, it is sunny, there hasn’t been raining (today).
God willing , it will rain again.
What do you want to eat?
Okay, we will go to a restaurant of a friend of mine.
Give me a spoon (fork / knife / bread).
I should like to drink, I am thirsty.
What do you want to drink?
Okay, ask him for the bill.
Could you bring us the bill please

interlinear-text.item: Seddat (Azila) Story about Abahlal and Amukyus

word.item: PN (a smart character from a story)

interlinear-text.item: Seddat (Talarwak). Frog Where are You = Lqiṣa n uqerqur

word.item: Tidighin the white mountain the big one
Tidighin you climb it evreything appears
you will see Spain's mountains you will see Ifran's
You will see Sira of ibaz and Buyeblan
you will see the sea and the mountains of Titwan
you will see the sea and boats fishing fish
The one who will go there he will feel calm and saftey
He will hear water flows and the birds songs
he will walk between the ceder and waterfull of the rivers
I run there to smell the clean air of the ceder
many people came there were lost
if you did not trust me ask the ones who went there
In Mulud it's full of people everyone is happy
It has a big history of the gone grandfathers
How are you doing? Everything allright?
They are all fine, praise the Lord, thank you
What are you up to? (lit. ‘what did you say’)
Okay, I’m leaving now, I have to do something.
Good, where did you learn Berber?
Good, what is your name? (lit. ‘what do they call you’)
My name is (Maria). (lit. ‘they call me Maria’)
I’m from the Netherlands, but I live in Tanger now, what about you?
I’m thirty-three years old, what about you?
Okay, I’m leaving, we will see each other, God willing.
Okay, God willing, so that’s it, bye bye

word.item: and this, he brought her to us
when will he bring to us
when will he bring her to us
when will he bring her to me
when will he bring her to you:fs
when will he bring her to you:ms
when will he bring her to them:mp
when will he bring her to you:fp
when will he bring her to you:ms
when (SUB) he bring her to you:ms
when will he bring her to you:fs
when will he bring her to him/her
when will he bring her to them
when will she bring him out?
when will she bring her out?

interlinear-text.item: Zerqet (Benjel) Story of Lmejdub, or Where does our language come from?

word.item: Abderrahman Lmejdub came from some world.
He brought a sack of language so that he will distribute it in the world.
He kept walking, walking, walking.... He traveled over Europe, he traveled over the Arab lands, he traveled... until he arrived here to Morocco.
When he arrived to Morocco, he came in Morocco, until he arrived to the region of Ketama, Bni Seddat, Beni Bounsar, Targuist...
Little language was left for him.
he shook it (f) out for them
He turned over that sack, he shook it out there for them.
He said to them, “Manage with this small amount until I return.
I will add here for you
I will go to add language for you, to complete for you your language.”
Abderrahman Lmejdub kept walking to return to that world from where he brought language for them.
When he arrived to that world to bring language for them, he found that language was finished.
Language was distributed, there did not remain (any) language, that's it.
He stayed there, he did not return to them, and they are still waiting for him to bring (language) for them so that they will complete their language.
And now, he left them speaking a mixed language.
Everyone is speaking, each one answers another with their own speech.
And he still he did not return to them, that's it, he stayed there.

interlinear-text.item: Zerqet (Benjel) Story of Lmejdub, or Where does our language come from? (ELAN version)

word.item: He brought a sack of language
to distribute it in the world.

word.item: he shook it (f) out for them

interlinear-text.item: Zerqet (Bunjel) Story about Aghennuy= Aġennuy (old version)

word.item: There was a man, he was from Nador, from Zegengen, in a village they called Agennuy.
There came a time, this one, he killed someone from his family.
When he killed that man, he fled here with his children.
He passed here to the mountain, to Targuist, to the mountain of Targuist, on the side of Germalet.
The mountain, it contained only forest, there were no houses or anything.
He came, entered into the forest, took a little, made a shack, and hid his children.
Now, the people of the one he killed,
There came a time, they kept on looking for him.
They followed him, village after village, from Nador (from Zgengen), all the way to Agennuy.
They kept looking for him until they found him.
When they found him, he - he remembered them, but they - they did not remember him.
They requested to lodge with him.
He fed them supper, they slept well. The next morning, he got them up.
He took them breakfast, they breakfasted well.
They asked him, they said to him, “There’s this certain man, look he did such and such and such and such.
Look, we have come looking for him.
Now if we find him, we'll kill him.
He said to them, "That man for whom you are looking, Look, I am he.
Now, if you are looking to kill me, Look, that's right now.
But if you are looking to go back to your homes,
Look, he is I, the one who killed that man near you in Agennuy.
That's it, those men, they looked one to another, they were ashamed to kill him.
They had eaten supper, breakfasted, slept,
So they were ashamed to kill him.
I left them there and came home.
Hey Mum, tomorrow is grandma's birthday.
Do you want to cook her something with me?
You remember, I was travelling the other day,
and I met someone who showed me how to cook a nice dish.
Oh, what is the dish called?
I forgot the name, but I remember it was a fish rolled in a leaf.
I can show you how it's done,
and we can prepare it for grandma together.
Good, do we have all the ingredients that are needed (for the dish)?
Yes, let's start cooking, I'll teach you.
I will make you cook the whole dish yourself.
Oh thanks, I want to learn,
so that later I can do it on my own.
First, please take the fish from the fridge,
unwrap it, wash it clean, and bring it here.
Shall I just put it on the table?
Well, just lay it on the {board // leaf} here.
Now remove its scales and take out its gills with a sharp knife.
No, it's not very sharp, it's dull.
Take a sharper one from over there.
Okay, I'll take this knife right here (next to me).
With that knife, slash the fish slowly.
Be careful, so that you don't cut yourself!
When you're done slashing the fish,
and squeeze it all over the fish.
Let the lemon juice soak in for 10 minutes.
No, you don't need to squeeze the whole lemon.
Squeeze just enough for the fish.
OK, I've done the whole fish.
Now sit down on the old chair here.
But be careful so that you don't break it (by sitting on it)!
Now you can start peeling three shallots and two cloves of garlic.
Then (sit and) grind them together with red chilies and one candlenut.
Oh, and don't forget the salt and sugar!
Okay, I've finished grinding everything fine.
Pour the ground spices onto the fish,
and roll it in (so that it's closed).
How can I roll the leaf up so that the fish doesn't fall out?
Ah, yes, I see. It's not easy to roll it up well!
Find a small wooden stick and pierce it through the leaf on both sides.
Almost. Just try to make it a bit tighter.
put the wrapped fish on top,
and close it with a lid.
Done! When will it be ready?
Well, you can't eat it raw like this.
You must leave it to steam for half an hour.
Tomorrow, we can make the dish even more aromatic.
We will take the steamed wrap and grill it over fire, right before we give it to grandma.
Yes, I think she will like it a lot.
If she likes it, we can make it again next year.
Thank you for teaching me a new dish!
It is always better to cook together than alone.
This way, we can help each other!
This makes cooking easier, and also more fun!

interlinear-text.item: Zerqet (Ikherruden). Frog Where are You = Lqiṣṣa n uqerqur

word.item: One night a boy had a frog. He put it in a glass bottle, and he sat down in front of him laughing because he was happy with that frog and his dog picking on that frog to the bottle.
At night when the boy and his dog slept that frog came out from that glass bottle,
Next morning when the boy and his dog woke up, he picked on the glass bottle they found the frog is not in the bottle
So that boy got up looking at that frog to see if he could find it, looking in shoes etc,, nothing, and his dog put his head in that glass bottle.
That boy opened the window looking outside and calling on the frog.
and his dog still stuck with his head in that glass bottle where the frog were in
after that. that dog fall down from the window and that boy was afraid on him
that dog when he fall down to the ground the bottle of glass broke ,the boy came down he carried the dog but he was angry
so that boy and his dog went out in the forest looking for the frog , that dog smells where that frog went and that boy calling the frog

they kept going and they arrived to a place that boy found a hole he kept looking in it and calling to see if he can find his frog, and the do sow a beehive of bees in a tree and it kept jumping trying to rich it.
that boy a squirrel came out to him from the that hole it frightened him, and that dog was still jumping on the tree wants to rich that beehive of bees,
that boy climbed on a tree looking in another hole to see if he can find his frog, and the dog dropped that bee beehive, fall down to the ground

that hole in the tree where the boy was looking in there was an owl in it, it came out and frighten the boy and he fall down from the tree to the ground on his back , and that dog because he dropped that bee beehive they followed him sting him, so he run away and they fallowed him.
and that owl kept fallowing that boy hitting him to the head and he covers on his head with his hand, and he climbed on some rocks
That owl went back home, and that boy climbed on those rocks and found some branches and he grabbed them, and that dog set down next to those rocks huddling because he was hurt by bees,

the dog got up went behind the rock to see what's there, and that boy the branches he was grabbing were not branches of the tree but they were horns of the deer, the deer raised his head and that boy was still hanging on the head grabbing to his horns,
that deer got afraid so he ran away, and the dog followed him running with him, and that boy was still hanging on the deer's horns.
that deer arrived to a cliff stopped but that boy fall down from the horns of the deer, and that dog fall down from that cliff,
That boy fell down first and that dog fell on him , both of them fell to the water,and that deer kept looking at them from above the cliff.
that boy got up and his dog ascended on his shoulders, but that boy heard something behind a fallen tree trunk in that river,
he put down his dog in the water and went behind that fallen tree trunk and said to the dog: " shut up don't make noise"
They climbed on that fallen tree trunk, the boy and his dog, so they looked behind that tree trunk to see what's there.
When they took a look they found a male and female frog behind that fallen tree trunk, and they kept looking at them.
after a while their small kids jumped from the grass with them even the frog of that boy, and that boy was happy him and his dog,

That boy carried his frog in his hand and went home, he and his dog, and when he was going in the road that young boy turned he said to them: :take care" to those frogs and their young kids, they were all on that fallen tree trunk in the river.

interlinear-text.item: Zerqet (Ikherruden). CQ01. We are going fishing = nɛeddu a nṣiyeḏ̣

word.item: Well, we’re walking down to the river, over there.
What for? Are youPL going to be bathing?
We’ll try to catch some river fish for dinner.
Oh I see. Is there a celebration in the village, or something?
We just need food for our family.
My wife had bought a chicken at the market the other day,​Press Enter to copy in Word Glosses, or start typing.
but our children ate it all already:
now we have nothing left at home!
Besides, we don’t have enough money any more.
We really have to go fishing today.
I’m sorry that youPL have no food left.
I can help youPL, my friends.
My husband and I, we have lots of vegetables from our garden,
which he harvested yesterday, and brought back home.
If you want, we can give youPL some.
YouPL’ll give us some vegetables, and we’ll give youPL some fish.

interlinear-text.item: Zerqet (Ikherruden). CQ02. Prepairing for the new year = l'istiɛdad za lɛam žḏiḏ

word.item: In two months’ time, we’ll have celebrations for the New Year
Oh, that’s right. This time, the people from village X {adapt name} will all be coming to our community:
men and women, children, old people, entire families…
We should welcome them in a friendly way,
‎just like they did to us last year
.Yes of course, like we always do.
Our leaders will start with a welcome speech.
Then, people will pray in the morning.
After that, we’ll all share lunch together.
In the afternoon, I hope we can have songs and dances.
The people of X will sing their songs, dance their dances;
we too, we shall sing our own songs, and do our own dances…
As we find some rest, our elders will be able to tell stories from the olden times, for the young to hear.
And then, in the late afternoon, our two communities will part again.
That will be the end of the day of celebration.
Remember that you and I are in charge of the organization this year.
Perhaps we INC:DU should call a meeting tomorrow morning in the community
and tell our people what they should do.
Some of us can clean the village area,
​set up the place for the celebration.
Other people can make the costumes for the dances.
We must choose which dances to showcase;
Also, don’t forget: we’ll have to prepare food,
enough food for two hundred people.
Oh dear, that will be a lot of work for us all.
A lot of work indeed. Let us start today!

interlinear-text.item: Zerqet (Ikherruden). CQ03. Seeing the doctor = Ġu doctor

word.item: Good morning Doctor, how are you?
Well… I’m not feeling well these days.
That’s why I came to see you.
What’s happening to you? You look sick.
I can’t sleep well at night.
I sweat, I have nightmares, and then I wake up in the middle of the night.
Sometimes I feel hot, sometimes I’m cold. I must have fever?
Let me check your forehead… Oh yes, you’re hot!
But every time I wake up, I’m very thirsty; I feel I need to drink.
And also, my belly hurts. It’s painful.
Does it hurt during the day? or only at night?
Mostly at night. I don’t know why.
Doctor, I’m a bit worried: what is going on?
Did you eat anything particular lately?
Hm, let me remember… No, I don’t think so.
Oh wait, actually yes I did!
Last week, my child came back from the forest with some strange fruit I had never seen.
He gave them to me, for me to try.
Yes I did. Actually I liked it, it was sweet. I ate many of them.
But then, I became sick after that.
I see. It must have been that fruit that made you sick.
If you hadn’t eaten so much, you wouldn’t have gotten sick like this.
Oh Doctor, you’re right. I shouldn’t have.
Don’t worry. I’ll give you some medicine for you to drink.
You will take it twice a day: once in the morning, and once again in the evening, after dinner. Alright?
Alright Doctor. And then I’ll be better?
Yes, you should get better soon.
This is efficient medicine against fever and belly-ache.
Also, you must get some rest.
Don’t go to work: you need to sleep.
Alright Doctor, I understand. I’ll get some rest.

interlinear-text.item: Zerqet (Ikherruden). CQ05. A family album = L'album lɛa'ila

word.item: Have you ever seen pictures of my family?
Well, I’ve met some of your relatives, but I’ve never seen your pictures.
Here is an old photo album I just found in my parents’ room.
Oh, show it to me please!
Who’s this on that first photo?
It looks like olden times, it’s in black and white.
These are my grandparents, on my mother’s side:
Grandpa here on the left, and Grandma on the right.
The people around them must be their friends, or other relatives.
Was that the day of their wedding?
No, I don’t think so. On their wedding, they were older than this.
This must have been the day when they got engaged.
In those times, the day of engagement used to be a major event for the whole family,
and people would wear beautiful clothes, and all.
Yes, your grandparents on the photo.
Actually no. I heard they died before I was born.
They were born a long time ago.
Oh I see. And who’s that on the second photo?
This is my mother, when she was a child
I guess she was coming back from school: look at her schoolbag.
Oh yeah, nice. And the small boy behind her, who’s that?
That’s my uncle Teri. You haven’t met him, he lives far away from here.
And what school did they attend then?
That was an old school that doesn’t exist any more.
It was located down the road to the west, towards the lake.
Let me see this other photo.
This woman is surely your mother again, carrying a child on her back.
Oh, I think I know who this child is. That’s you!
That’s me indeed! How did you recognize me?
Well, on that photo you’re a small child,
but I recognize your eyes and your smile.
You look mischievous on that picture.
Ha ha. But I’m not a child any more, I’ve grown up now.
Today my mother would not be able to carry me on her back like that!
I’m taller than her, and heavier too.
Ha, that’s true. You’ve eaten too much!

interlinear-text.item: Zerqet (Ikherruden). CQ07. We want to visit grandma = Nešu anẓur ḥenna

word.item: Why are you still sitting around playing?
We should not wait any longer.
Oh yes, Daddy, if we want to reach grandma’s house before sunset,
Good, please don’t forget to bring the gifts for grandma.
She asked us to buy her some bananas, a new scarf and an umbrella.
Can you carry all that in your bag?
Yes, I’ve put it all in my bag.
Oh wait, I think I forgot the scarf!
I’ll go back into the house and get it quickly.
Please hurry up, we don’t want to arrive at her place too late.
I’m back. Now we’ve got everything for grandma.
I know the way to grandma's place and will show it to you.
And next time, you’ll remember the way.
There’s a root right in front of you.
If you had tripped (over it), you would’ve hurt yourself.
It's not a root, it's just a branch.
See, I can step on it and it breaks.
Let's just continue following the river.
Oh, Daddy, look up there in the tree, what's that?
Where? I can’t see anything there.
Look carefully between the two big branches there.
Oh dear, that’s a snake hanging waiting for its prey.
Come over here, don't get too close to that tree.
One must be very careful when walking through the forest.
The snake is green like the leaves, so it’s not easy to see.
Daddy, I'm not scared, I'm already a big boy.
Now let’s continue our walk to grandma’s place.
Daddy, can you hear that noise? What’s that?
Yes, I also just heard something.
It must be coming from the hills over there.
I think I can hear a person singing.
You know what? I think I know what it is.
I can hear it very clearly now.
It’s a bird that is chirping cheerfully in the trees.
And because of the mountains, we can hear the echo.
Oh, it sounds really beautiful, but maybe we should continue walking?
You’re right, let’s walk before it starts to rain.
Can you see the clouds up there?
I hope we won’t get wet.
But if it rains, we can use the umbrella we’re bringing for grandma.
We still need to cross the bridge ahead,
then we must turn left, then turn right,
and then you’ll see a small hill that we need to climb.
Grandma lives in the village behind that hill.
It’s still a long way, right?
If you walk steadily, it won’t feel long.
Here we are, this is grandma’s house.
I’m happy we reached it before it’s become dark.
It was a lot of fun.
When I was your age, I would also follow my father, just like you.
I used to walk this way many times, so now I remember it well.
Yes, she will really like that.
We can give her the gifts now.
Take the glasses and the umbrella out of your bag.
Oh no! The umbrella squashed the bananas for grandma.
That’s a shame! Are all the bananas squashed?
It's okay, grandma will be happy to see you nevertheless.
Some men are better to do without.
The goat sweeps where she sleeps
When the falcon lives, so do his children.
The only one who eats alone is the wolf.
May God cause us to meet
May God join us with one who is better than us.
May God bring those who will do good for? them
One who travels much is better than one who lives long.
The terraces fell down for us a lot.
For example, here's the garden plot, in the flatland,
this is its terrace of stone -- stone and dirt.
then terraces they slid down, they fell, by much rain, you understand ?
‎‎‎Rain hit hard, our terraces were destroyed, the garden plots slid down.
it was soaked, soaked with rain.
‎‎‎It had a lot of dirt, and not much stone.
‎‎‎Dirt, it had dirt winning, it slid down.
‎‎‎It ruined for us our garden plot, you understand?
‎‎‎Later, we needed to turn over [the soil]
‎‎‎We need to turn over the garden plot, to turn it over with a akerruc (claw)
‎‎‎When the terraces fell, we went to collect rocks above the road.
We find there a house. we roll [them?] at it,
from there is where we brought down stone -- Rhimo and I.
‎‎‎That's it, we brought it down to the road, we just push on it downhill,
we push on it, it comes, it comes from the road.
‎‎‎That's it, when it went toward there, that's it, we collected there quite a bit of stone.
‎‎‎One day she said to me, she said, "What are we going to do?"
‎‎‎She said, "Now, we need to do potatoes; we need to fix our garden plot."
‎‎‎I said to her, "Of course we will fix it."
‎‎‎‎‎I said to her, "But we need stone; we need tires."
‎‎‎That's it, we went to collect stone, some two or three days; we go to collect stone, it gets almost noon, we come by ourselves.
‎‎‎We come, we do our lunch, we wash_ablution, we pray, we eat lunch, we do housework,
‎‎‎If we have enough time, we go back and collect.
‎‎‎If it's too near sunset, in the evening, that's it, then we just do housework and relax.
what will we do for it
‎‎‎That's it, later, when we collected them, she said to me, "Now I, what will we do for it?"
‎‎‎she said to me, "You.f, you're not able to carry here."
‎‎‎She said to me, "I'll go and carry just a little at a time, and we'll collect some in the river.
‎‎‎In the river, in fact, is difficult.
‎‎‎In the river, not the side of the road for cars, the side of the spring from where we fill water.
‎‎‎We know one place by the river, we go up there to the gardens ... but it's difficult.
‎‎‎Anyway, we took it up from the river to the garden -- stone, on our backs.
‎‎‎Stone was there, much rain had hit hard, and thunder, the river had swollen a lot, and many stones appeared.
‎‎‎We gathered it there, I arrange for her three or four, she carries them.
‎‎‎That's it, we go again, again I arrange for her, we carry.
‎‎‎That one above, I said to her, "We'll do helpers.f."
‎‎‎we looked, they said to us, "we will help you."
‎‎‎I go in the evening, I say to her, "Tomorrow, if God wills, will you be able to help me?"
‎‎‎If you're not going anywhere, tomorrow, God willing..." so that, I tell them in the evening, so that,
I tell her by evening, so that,
‎‎‎not until the following day, she'll be going to the forest or going to some place or ...
‎‎‎she'll say to me, "Well, if you had told it to me yesterday, now I'm going to another place." You understand?
‎‎‎"Now I have work, I'm going some place," she'll tell me, "If you had told it to me yesterday," You understand?
‎‎‎We tell them in the evening, so that they are preparing themselves for the following day, in the morning, you understand?
‎‎‎That's it, I went to them, looking them up.
‎‎‎I said to her, to Rhimu, "There are helpers.f"
‎‎‎That's it, I got up early -- I had gathered quite a lot, thirteen helpers.f!
‎‎‎I got up early, we did them breakfast, they came, ate breakfast,
‎‎‎That's it. Rhimu went with them, I stayed in the house.
‎‎‎I stayed in the house, again so that I would prepare them something to eat again around 10:00 -- not to mention lunch -- around 10:00.
‎‎‎That's it, Rhimu went with them; she arranges for them, they carry to the garden plot, carrying stone.
‎‎‎I stayed in the house, again I did tea for them, did food for them.
‎‎‎They ate there, where we collected stone, there is where they ate.
‎‎‎I said to her, "Will you.p come to the garden?"
‎‎‎They said to me, "No, not at all."
‎‎‎They said to you, "We are carrying, we don't need to rest."
‎‎‎"We need to help you.p, so that we can gather a lot, so that you.p can continue and fix your gardens."
‎‎‎That's it, I took them again to there, they ate, I collected my stuff and came back alone.
‎‎‎She again, Rhimu, stayed with them, Rhimu was overseeing them, arranging for them, carrying with them.
‎‎‎I _____, I wasn't able to carry, so that I needed to prepare in the house.
May God have mercy on her

‎‎‎That's it, again I came to that work, I made them lunch, again I did work in the house, again I gave to the livestock what to eat, I prepared for my mother -- may God have mercy on her -- again what to eat,
‎‎‎That's it, again it was almost lunchtime, a little rain came.
‎‎‎I said to her, to Rhimu, I said to her, "That's it, they will stop." I said to her, "They will stop."
‎‎‎I told her, "Now rain is coming." I told her, "May God give us rain."
‎‎‎I told her, "Tell the girls to come to the house."
‎‎‎Even though rain was hitting, a little rain was hitting, and they were almost getting wet, they were telling her, "No, even though we get wet, the world is at peace."
‎‎‎"We need to help you.p; we need to carry."
She told her, "No, not at all."
She told her, "Don't add even one more time, don't add it."
‎‎‎She said to her, "To the house." She said to her, "Go.pl on."
‎‎‎She told her, "Come.pl on, we'll eat lunch and rest, that's it."
‎‎‎That's it, they.f came, ate lunch, rested a bit, stayed talking, dancing,
‎‎‎Listen! they really liked it! It's activity,
it's -- talking, each person says what he wants, they laugh ...
‎‎‎That's it, they finished eating lunch, they said, "May God have mercy on your parents."
‎‎‎They said to you, "May God pardon you, in the world and the afterlife."
‎‎‎"We wanted to, we wanted to, with our own choice, to come, you didn't force us to.
‎‎‎We wanted to come and help you, the world is at peace."
‎‎‎That's it, when they had eated lunch, leaving on their own, the girls agreed and told her, "Now we've eaten, we go our separate ways, right?"
‎‎‎They told her, "Please pardon us - may God have mercy on your parents."
‎‎‎She said to Rhimu, "Come on with us."
‎‎‎We're going to add two more trips, then we'll go our separate ways."

‎‎‎She told her, "Why are you putting yourselves through so much like this. For us - the world is at peace. If it had been only tea, that would have been enough. For us - no problem. We're not outsiders."
‎‎‎She told her, "You are working hard on our account, and getting tired, and sweating on our account, and we, should we covet something? That can't be!
‎‎‎That which is, you should give them and rejoice in them.
‎‎‎And even you need to stand with them.
There are few who request reconciliation.
it was they fought some of people there, with us.
they fought near us some people, some women, some girls, with a man, Right??
he arose that man, he does not see well.
he doesn't see, I mean, the thing near, he sees her, but far, way over there, he does not recognize (it).
we came from the forest, at midday of evening, we came almost at sunset.
she prayer-called sunset,... still we had not entered the house.
that man, I did not hear them ourselves, they are fighting between them.
he came up to me, they passed by to fight, they came they are running, (to) the side of our house.
they came... this one hitting that one,
they came, to the side of our house.
they are running here, she from there, (along the) road,
the wife of my grandfather, she called,< God is than this is a villian!>
"God is than this is a villian, O servants of God!"
I went out by her oven, that man he occupied the place, he had come there.
I, I said to her, "what's there?"
And I, he thought (that I was) one of those girls he was fighting
He said, "Even you.f are you here?>
he hit me where we stand with one son of the wife of my grandfather.
Where you.p come out from the house, Right??
you find here oven with some sheet metal, Right??
That's_it, I did like this, I cry, I fell to the ground.
Rehimu, it was counted to her that I, I was hitting with them.
she did not see here for me
she came, she did not see here for me the injury.
she came, she hit me here myself!
she said to me, "what you.s did do?"
she said to me, "why did you come out?"
I was absent, That's_it, I saw nothing,
I fainted, I lost my memory, That's_it,
I wasn't alert where I had come.
Just the blood that I saw, and there the injuries,
There is the stream like this, waters go down in it from the faucet,
when water spills there, in the path.
so there, that place, it is not good,
The place is dirty, so the place is haunted.
With what did I fall? I fell there, with blood, with everything,
the sneakers the blood, the socks they became all blood,
On my face, I lost this tooth this one,
This (tooth) fell out, he broke it, only a little remained.
he hit me, and I have still a scar, a little of a stamp, Right?
this place it was left for me sunken in.
it was left for me sunken in.
it disappears for me like this.
That's it, I passed by here to the hospital.
we went we to register on him with the Gendarmerie
we went to the Gendarmerie, we registered on him.
Later the son of my aunt came,
he said to my mother, Allah have mercy on her, he said to her,< Auntie>,
He said to her, "Now what will you.p do with this man?"
she said to her, "what will you do?"
she said to her, "the girl, here she is who is here."
she said to him, "The nostrils there they is gone, the eyes here they is gone, the tooth is gone."
she did not do to him
"And the girl, she did to him nothing."
she did not do to him
"This girl she just came out by the house, she did not do to him even a little."
she said to him, "Is it not shameful that he do harm to a girl of someone else?"
He said to her, "Now what will you.p do?"
she said to him, "Provide herself (It's up to her)."
she said to him, "Here she is who is here," to me.
she said to him, "Whatever she decides."
she said to him, "The pain, here he is in her herself, it's not here in me myself."
She said to him, "How do you want us to be reconciled?"
"This girl, still she hasn't passed the scanner ...
"she does not know whether there is something (wrong)."
That's it, that man he did not come to us to ask forgiveness...
he sends here people to me.
they say to me, "Over there he tells you.f Hmed, "Now, please (lit: May God watch you), now, now, be reconciled."
I said to him, "why did he never come to me himself to request from me pardon?"
he will say to me, "Forgive me, I hit you wrongly."
"Now are you able to forgive me?"
"I did not do it to you on purpose."
07.22 I said to him, "Even I then I will see it what I will do.>
I said to her, "He himself did not come to me, and you.p, he sends you yourselves here?"
I said to him, "Look, you all. I don't need even one face from you.p to stand with me myself."
I said to him, "the one who did the wrong, he is the one who comes he will plead, he will say to me, 'Forgive me.'"
and he he says to them to the men, "I did to her like_that, still I would do to her more."
he found ones standing with him.
From the beginning, I was looking for helpers on Thursday.
you brought it (supplies) on Tuesday, however at that point we brought down only cement and brick, Right??
There remained the stone and sand.
I brought sacks I filled only sand.
we carried it we carried sand first, we finished it day -- it was that day.
we carried sand, we went (out) at noon.
We did not begin in the morning.
until noon, then we went and filled, despite the sun.
however, we went I filled in sacks, we carried
and at the last I myself am filling for them and girls they were taking down to the house.
and girls they were taking down
we finished it almost at sunset.
(1:40) when the sun disappeared, That's_it, and we finished it.
we, we finished it, we entered house, sunset is calling to prayer day Wednesday.
I went I looked for girls I told it to some of my family
I said to him/her < come you.PL help me>
they said to me <Did you look_for someone, or not?>
they said to me <Y/N you said it to girls?
Did you.sg look_for girls carrying it (here)?>
I said to him/her <I didn't find>
I said to him/her, <I didn't find
I said to him/her <are you able to come?>
They said to me, <I don't know>
they said to me< now we have work>
they said to me < if some... perhaps until, until till tomorrow>
till its tomorrow I sat I am waiting.
At noon on Thursday, although we went and we carried, no one appeared.
sand we carried, we would finish it at evening.
we started it in noon... we will start it for me...
I with daughter of my grandfather,
daughters of my grandfather, those that (were there) that day that he would carry (here) brick
and wife of my paternal uncle, and his daughter, she was here in the city
Saida, daughter of my paternal uncle, she was not here with us with stone, she carried with us only brick
sand and stone, she did not carry with us
girls of my grandfather, and wife of my paternal uncle, and I.
and another woman, she saw us carrying
May God reward you with good
I said to him/her <May God reward you with good.
Let's go, carry(here) with us one time>
she went she brought with us two times__ two times.
she said< if_there_were NEG I have work then I helped you.fp until you.p finished>
I said to him/her< world calm.f>
she came down, he/she has donkey,
she is gathering grass on him/her she carried on him/her grass
she said to me< what are you doing?>
I said to him/her <I'm carrying sand>
she said to me< carry NEG two times,, times, four of times.
carry on him/her, then from on him/her
I carried on him/her, almost sunset
they carried her (here) with me girls
I myself carried on the donkey
on the donkey myself I drove donkey
They.F I am leading them.F. They.F are carrying on back
you plan to come to me
if I show up, "That's what it will be."
you plan to come to me
I said to him, "If you plan to come to me, send me your son, he return (news) for me,"

interlinear-text.item: Zerqet CQ04 Where is my notebook? =Ani defftar n ttamarin inu?

word.item: Brother, have you seen my notebook?
I’ve been looking for it everywhere, but I can’t find it!
I don’t know, sister. Which notebook?
I don’t know, sister. Which notebook?
I was doing my homework on it last night in the dining room.
Well, you probably left it there, then!
No. I put it away in my schoolbag before I went to sleep. I think.
Hm, did you look in our room, beside your bed?
Yes I did; it’s not there.
Or perhaps on Dad’s desk, maybe it’s hidden under another book?
Wait… No, I can’t find it.
Let me look in the kitchen… Hm, not here either.
But I need it for my math class today!
The teacher will be quite angry if I don’t have my notebook with me.
He will think I didn’t do my homework.
Uh oh… I think I found it!
Look at our little brother out there in the garden.
What’s that he’s holding in his hands?
Oh my god, yes it is. But he has shredded it into pieces!
It looks like he’s been playing with it all morning.
Oh dear, what happened to my homework?!
Now I need to buy a new notebook,
​Press Enter to copy in Word Glosses, or start typing.
​Press Enter to copy in Word Glosses, or start typing.
he helps his father in agriculture, He takes care of his livestock,
he stayed just a simple man.
A relative will die, they are old
one day they went to the city to their child.
they told him, " Our son, we charge you
and your brother, you should take care of him.
we are going to die there is nothing left.
this trusteeship we tell you, you have to put it in your head
He told them, okay,I have just one brother
They went back, after days, they died,
there was just that poor son alone in the countryside.
that dealer thought about the trusteeship of his father and his mother,
he said in his mind, look my mother and my father are died
the told me, take care of your brother, don't leave him.
He got up and he went up to the mountain, he brought him
when he brought him, he kept take care of him, he taught him,he made him his own house.
He kept studying until he became a judge
But, the one who was living good, the rich one.
a time came, he wanted to go to the Hajj,
and he recommend his brother, he told him,
Oh brother now I will go to the Hajj,
And you, I'm leaving you trustee in my place,
you will be charged my businesses here,
As for my wife, I have told the slave,
you will be giving him her groceries so he can take them to her in a basket,
and I have told my wife, to not open the door to anyone,
He told him that's it brother, we are brothers, no problem
this is all what you asked, I will do with you more than this
He told him, that's it, this is what I charge you.
That dealer got up, he went to the with his friend.
but in that time they were coming back after a year.
this brother of his who he had left in his place, the younger one ,
he wanted to control, to follow,
he dose not give it to her
that slave who is taking the groceries to his brother's wife, Do he give it to her or not.
When he followed him in the alleys, watching him,
until he arrived his house, he kept watching him from a corner,
he went and knock in the door that slave,
that women said to him,who knocks in this door,
this door of the Book and Sun-nah.
he told her, I'm near, I'm your slave,
She lower the rub from the window and the basket
so he could fell it with groceries that he brought.
his brother the judge sow her
and that woman , she is beautiful, the beauty that GOD gave her, a lot
When he saw her, he was lovestruck (lit: his knees buckled)
he said in his mind, my brother
has all this beauty, like this and we never sow her.
such beauty in his brother’s wife he had never seen before.
one day, he send her a bad women, one old woman, she is old
they were marrying with girls that were not serving NEG God.
he was grived God Loving One, why people REL in him evil.
he came one human being they call him Noah
he he was that being righteous,
God Loving One was pleased on him
he saw God Loving One REL the earth corrupted_be
we are going to destroy them
one woman, her name (COP) Naomi his/her with his/her.
She hungered much, It was hard on her.
she with her family emptied the land
She married boys his/her from the land REL in_which they were.
not in her land, from the land where they went.
and are died children his/her, stay COP live only bride his/her, woman his/her.
so that she will return to her land.
go_out they with she daughter-in-law his/her from that land REL in_which they were.
